meanings.definition: To give a sharp, shrill cry.
meanings.sent1: The little bird would yill loudly when it saw a cat.
meanings.sent2: She yilled for help when she tripped and fell.
meanings.sent3: The baby yilled in delight when tickled by its mother.
meanings.sent4: The wind yilled through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The kettle began to yill as the water inside boiled furiously.

meanings.sent1: His yill echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent2: The crowd's yill of excitement filled the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's yill startled the students awake during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The yill of the referee signaled the end of the match.
meanings.sent5: The yill of the fire alarm sent everyone rushing out of the building.

meanings.sent1: She would always yill about having to do chores.
meanings.sent2: He yilled about the long line at the grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The cat would yill at being given the wrong food.
meanings.sent4: The old man would yill at the kids playing too loudly outside.
meanings.sent5: The customer began to yill about the poor service at the restaurant.
